Member Function Documentation

void TwitLib::GetPublicTimeline (  ) 

Returns the 20 most recent statuses from non-protected users who have set a custom user icon. Does not require authentication.

Definition at line 19 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetSingleStatus ( int  id  ) 

Returns a single status, specified by the id parameter below. The status's author will be returned inline.

Parameters:
id Required. The numerical ID of the status you're trying to retrieve.

Definition at line 24 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetFeaturedUsers (  ) 

Returns a list of the users currently featured on the site with their current statuses inline.

Definition at line 29 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::Logout (  ) 

Ends the session of the authenticating user, returning a null cookie. Use this method to sign users out of client-facing applications like widgets.

Definition at line 34 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::Login ( std::string  user,
std::string  password 
)

Attempts to establish an authorized connection with Twitter.

Definition at line 39 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetDowntimeSchedule (  ) 

Returns the same text displayed on http://twitter.com/home when a maintenance window is scheduled, in the requested format.

Definition at line 44 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::IsTwitterUp (  ) 

Returns the string "ok" in the requested format with a 200 OK HTTP status code.

Definition at line 49 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetUsersTimeline ( SERVER::Option2 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted from the authenticating user. It's also possible to request another user's timeline via the id parameter below. This is the equivalent of the Web /archive page for your own user, or the profile page for a third party.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 54 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetFavorites ( std::string  user = "",
int  page = 1 
)

Returns the 20 most recent favorite statuses for the authenticating user or user specified by the ID parameter in the requested format.

Parameters:
user Optional. The ID or screen name of the user for whom to request a list of favorite statuses.

Definition at line 59 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetFriendsTimeline ( SERVER::Option1 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns the 20 most recent statuses posted by the authenticating user and that user's friends. This is the equivalent of /home on the Web.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 64 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::PostNewStatus ( std::string  status  ) 

Updates the authenticating user's status. Requires the status parameter specified below. Request must be a POST.

Parameters:
status Required. The text of your status update. Be sure to URL encode as necessary. Must not be more than 160 characters and should not be more than 140 characters to ensure optimal display.

Definition at line 69 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetRecentReplies ( SERVER::Option3 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns the 20 most recent (status updates prefixed with ) for the authenticating user.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 74 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::RemoveStatus ( int  id  ) 

Destroys the status specified by the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the author of the specified status.

Parameters:
id Required. The ID of the status to destroy.

Definition at line 79 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetFriends ( SERVER::Option4 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns up to 100 of the authenticating user's friends who have most recently updated, each with current status inline. It's also possible to request another user's recent friends list via the id parameter below.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 84 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetFollowers ( SERVER::Option5 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns the authenticating user's followers, each with current status inline. They are ordered by the order in which they joined Twitter (this is going to be changed).

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 89 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetUserDetails ( std::string  user  ) 

Returns extended information of a given user, specified by ID or screen name as per the required id parameter below. This information includes design settings, so third party developers can theme their widgets according to a given user's preferences. You must be properly authenticated to request the page of a protected user.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of a user.

Definition at line 94 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetSentDirectMessages ( SERVER::Option6 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent by the authenticating user. The XML and JSON versions include detailed information about the sending and recipient users.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 99 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::GetReceivedDirectMessages ( SERVER::Option6 *  opt = NULL  ) 

Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user. The XML and JSON versions include detailed information about the sending and recipient users.

Parameters:
opt Optional. Options which can be user specified.

Definition at line 104 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::SendDirectMessage ( std::string  user,
std::string  text 
)

Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user. Requires both the user and text parameters below. Request must be a POST. Returns the sent message in the requested format when successful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of the recipient user.
text Required. The text of your direct message. Be sure to URL encode as necessary, and keep it under 140 characters.

Definition at line 109 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::RemoveDirectMessage ( int  id  ) 

Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.

Parameters:
id Required. The ID of the direct message to destroy.

Definition at line 114 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::AddFriendship ( std::string  user  ) 

Befriends the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the befriended user in the requested format when successful. Returns a string describing the failure condition when unsuccessful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of the user to befriend.

Definition at line 119 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::RemoveFriendship ( std::string  user  ) 

Discontinues friendship with the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the un-friended user in the requested format when successful. Returns a string describing the failure condition when unsuccessful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of the user with whom to discontinue friendship.

Definition at line 124 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::FriendshipExist ( std::string  user_a,
std::string  user_b 
)

Tests if a friendship exists between two users.

Parameters:
user_a Required. The ID or screen_name of the first user to test friendship for.
user_b Required. The ID or screen_name of the second user to test friendship for.

Definition at line 129 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::VerifyCredentials (  ) 

Returns an HTTP 200 OK response code and a format-specific response if authentication was successful. Use this method to test if supplied user credentials are valid with minimal overhead.

Definition at line 134 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::UpdateLocation ( std::string  location  ) 

Updates the location attribute of the authenticating user, as displayed on the side of their profile and returned in various API methods. Works as either a POST or a GET.

Parameters:
location Required. The location of the user. Please note this is not normalized, geocoded, or translated to latitude/longitude at this time.

Definition at line 139 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::UpdateDeliveryDevice ( SERVER::DEVICES  device  ) 

Sets which device Twitter delivers updates to for the authenticating user. Sending none as the device parameter will disable IM or SMS updates.

Parameters:
device Required. Must be one of: sms, im, none.

Definition at line 144 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::RemainingApiRequests (  ) 

Returns the remaining number of API requests available to the authenticating user before the API limit is reached for the current hour. Calls to rate_limit_status require authentication, but will not count against the rate limit.

Definition at line 149 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::AddFavorite ( int  id  ) 

Favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the favorite status when successful.

Parameters:
id Required. The ID of the status to favorite.

Definition at line 154 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::RemoveFavorite ( int  id  ) 

Un-favorites the status specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the un-favorited status in the requested format when successful.

Parameters:
id Required. The ID of the status to un-favorite.

Definition at line 159 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::StartFollow ( std::string  user  ) 

Enables notifications for updates from the specified user to the authenticating user. Returns the specified user when successful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of the user to follow.

Definition at line 164 of file TwitLib.cpp.

void TwitLib::StopFollow ( std::string  user  ) 

Disables notifications for updates from the specified user to the authenticating user. Returns the specified user when successful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen name of the user to leave.

Definition at line 169 of file TwitLib.cpp.

Blocks the user specified in the ID parameter as the authenticating user. Returns the blocked user in the requested format when successful.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen_name of the user to block.

Parameters:
user Required. The ID or screen_name of the user to un-block.
